content:
# elizaos/eliza Daily Update (Jan 16, 2026)
## OVERVIEW 
Today's development focused on a significant refactoring of the `plugin-sql` package, extracting domain stores for improved maintainability. Additionally, two user experience issues were closed, while new issues emerged concerning smart contract deployment, AI model integration, and a migration bug.

## KEY TECHNICAL DEVELOPMENTS

### SQL Plugin Refactoring for Modularity
The `BaseDrizzleAdapter` in the `plugin-sql` package underwent a major refactoring, extracting its functionality into composable domain stores. This change, while not altering the public API, significantly enhances maintainability, testability, and separation of concerns within the plugin. ([#6366](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6366))

## NEWLY OPENED PULL REQUESTS
No new pull requests were opened today.

## CLOSED ISSUES

### User Experience Improvements
Two issues related to user experience were closed today. One addressed the removal of the '+' symbol from personality traits and topics of interest fields, improving the user interface. ([#6350](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6350)) The other resolved the issue of users being redirected to the dashboard instead of their last agent chat session after logging in or signing up. ([#6354](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6354))

## NEW ISSUES

### Future Capabilities and Integrations
New issues were opened to explore future capabilities, including the ability to deploy smart contracts on-chain ([#6367](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6367)) and the integration of Opus 4.5 into ElizaOS applications ([#6368](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6368)).

### Migration and Wallet Discrepancy
A new issue was reported concerning a migration eligibility mismatch and a snapshot bug related to a Tangem hardware wallet, indicating potential challenges with asset migration. ([#6369](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6369))

## ACTIVE ISSUES
No active issues with more than 3 comments.
